intro: Tetragonia dimorphantha, commonly known as the coastal spinach, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and ability to thrive in harsh, saline environments. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, where it is adapted to withstand high salinity and limited water availability. Its leaves are edible and have a mild, spinach-like flavor, making it a valuable food source in certain regions. Tetragonia dimorphantha is also noted for its ornamental value due to its attractive, fleshy foliage and small, star-shaped flowers.
